metadata.subject: For Early 'Jersey Boys' Investors, Oh, What a Run

relationships.description: Yeh helps train and find jobs for butlers, connected to the butler training industry
Noble is an American trainer at the butler academy

analysis.purpose: To report on the growing trend of butler services among affluent Chinese families
analysis.significance: Documents cultural and economic shifts in China as wealthy families adopt Western luxury services

notable_quotes: "What they would like to say to their friends is, 'Look, I have a butler, an English-style butler in my home,' to show how wealthy they are"
"The country now with the biggest trend in butlers is China"
"Chinese people see that, experience top-class personal service abroad, and they want to experience it here"

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this news article

illegal_activity.description: This is a New York Times news article about butler services in China, not involving any illegal activity

details: Journalistic reporting on cultural trends in China

public_knowledge.context: This is a published New York Times article about cultural and economic trends in China

analysis.summary: This New York Times article reports on the growing trend of affluent Chinese families hiring English-style butlers as a status symbol, with butler training schools expanding in China to meet demand from wealthy individuals exposed to Western luxury services during international travel.
